definition: to be able to use/useable/to have a use for sth/(in interrogative sentence) to be necessary to
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Keep your exchange vouchers as you may need to show them when you are leaving the country.
sentences.chinese: 保留水单，以防离开这个国家时还用得着。

sentences.english: Like I need to use tricks?
When organizing clothing or other items on shelves, you should use shelf dividers .
sentences.chinese: 把衣服在架子上分好后，你就用得着衣架隔板了。

sentences.english: If you feel the need, give one a try.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得用得着就来试试吧。

sentences.english: I should be taking notes, maybe there are some I can use myself.
sentences.chinese: 我应该记笔记，或许有些我自己还能用得着。

sentences.english: For a dog, also need short swords?
sentences.chinese: 对付一条狗，也用得着拔剑吗？

sentences.english: Your children might need to use it.
sentences.chinese: 你的孩子们可能会用得着它。

sentences.english: B: We don't need it until next month.
sentences.chinese: 我们要到下个月才用得着。

sentences.english: And if you have, there are probably a few tips below you can use.
sentences.chinese: 如果你考虑过，那么以下几点建议也许你能用得着。
